name: Broadgauge
body:
# Mac Install Instructions

## ==For a Clean Mac install==
install brew:
http://brew.sh/

## == Python 2.7 ==  
`brew install python`

## == PostGresQL ==  
`brew install postgres`

## == Pip==

`sudo easy_install pip`

Check pip is installed:
`pip`

Should return:
`Usage: pip COMMAND [OPTIONS]` 
`pip: error: You must give a command (use "pip help" to see a list of commands)` 

## == VirtualEnv == 
install virtualenv

`sudo pip install virtualenv`

## == Git ==
Following this link:
http://git-scm.com/download/mac

## ==PyCharm== 
https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/download/

## ==Requirements Setup== 
Go to requirements page:
https://github.com/anandology/broadgauge


# Linux Install Instructions
These instructions are for Debian-based distros (like Ubuntu, Mint,...). Adjust to suit the package manager your distribution uses.

## == PyCharm ==
Follow the steps in this wiki: http://www.bonusbits.com/wiki/HowTo:Install_PyCharm_on_Ubuntu

## == Install dependencies (python, git, postgresql, virtualenv)
apt install virtualenv python git postgresql-9.4

Then follow the Readme instructions.



# Windows Install Instructions

## == Python ==
https://www.python.org/downloads/windows/

Download 2.7.10  - check if 64 bit version suits you by opening the "System" application
Run the installer.
In the "Customize Python" , ensure you select the option to install Python into the PATH

## == PostGresQL ==
http://www.postgresql.org/download/windows/
click the link starting at:
"Download the installer from EnterpriseDB for all supported versions."
which brings you to the "EnterpriseDB" website. Select Windows (64 bit if it suits)

Run the installer
If you see a Visual C++ dialog pop up, just ignore it.

Hit Next until you hit a "Password" prompt. You need to enter a password, take a note of it.
Hit Next until everything installed, the defaults are fine.

On the final page, *DO NOT* allow StackBuilder to run. You donâ€™t need the extra tools it will suggest.


## == Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 ==
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=44266
Install.

## == VirtualEnv ==
Open a Command Prompt, (Hit Windows key, type "command.exe" and hit enter)
Type:
	pip install virtualenv

## == Git ==
http://git-scm.com/downloads/win
Download & run the installer
Hit Next until page "Adjusting your PATH environment" and select the option: "Use GIT from the Windows Command Prompt"
Hit Next again until all done.

## == PyCharm ==
https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/download/
Select the "Download Community" option

Run the installer
Is good idea to associate the ".py" files with PyCharm (so double-clicking any python file opens it in PyCharm)
Just hit next and install.



## == Set up PostGreSQL ==

First we need to fix an issue with PostGres and Windows.  

1. Open Start menu, type "Command"  
2. Find a "Command Prompt" option, right-click it and select "Run as Administrator"  
3. Run  
	` notepad "C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\9.4\pg_env.bat"`  
4. Edit and replace  
	`@SET PATH="C:/Program Files/PostgreSQL/9.4\bin";%PATH%`  
   with  
	`@SET PATH=C:/Program Files/PostgreSQL/9.4\bin;%PATH%`  
   (i.e. just remove the double quotes)
   so it should look like:

`@ECHO OFF`
`REM The script sets environment variables helpful for PostgreSQL`

`@SET PATH=C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\9.4\bin;%PATH%`
`@SET PGDATA=C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\9.4\data`
`@SET PGDATABASE=postgres`
`@SET PGUSER=postgres`
`@SET PGPORT=5432`
`@SET PGLOCALEDIR=C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\9.4\share\locale`

5. Hit save

## ==Setting Up Virtual Env and Requirements==  

In PyCharm, open the "requirements.txt" file. Comment out the `"psycopg2"` line, by putting a # in front of it.
This module is broken in Windows. Instead need to install it manually: 

http://www.stickpeople.com/projects/python/win-psycopg/
Download the "Python 4.7" version that suits your laptop (32bit or 64bit)

Open a Terminal in PyCharm(hover mouse over bottom left icon, select Terminal)
Run these commands:

`virtualenv . `
`Scripts\activate `

You are now inside a Virtual Environment, whose only purpose is to serve this website.  
To set up the environment in Pip, run the following command: 
`"C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\9.4\pg_env.bat"`


Now install the win-psycopg2 download with:
`easy_install C:\Users\FAKE\FOLDERPATH\psycopg2-2.6.0.win-amd64-py2.7-pg9.4.1-release.exe`

Next:
	`pip install -r requirements.txt`

Create a database:
	`createdb pythonexpress`

Add schema:
	`psql pythonexpress < broadgauge/schema.sql`

Run the app:
	`python run.py`

In your web browser open:  
http://localhost:8080


## ==NOTE==

You don't have to create a new env everytime. 
Just run the following command: 
        `Scripts\activate`

Run the app:
	`python run.py` 


## ==FIN==

Congratulations! By now you wonder why you don't run Linux or have a Mac. You have probably also watched all the others with these devices happily get set up. If you would like help fixing this, just talk to us. ;-)
